results.filename: Aksel et al. - 2019 - An Unusual Case of Diffuse Pulmonary Meningotheliomatosis Accompanying with Cystic Lung Disease.pdf

data.filename: Aksel et al. - 2019 - An Unusual Case of Diffuse Pulmonary Meningotheliomatosis Accompanying with Cystic Lung Disease.pdf
data.symptom_narrative: Patient presented with cough and mild exertional dyspnea
data.discovery_reason: Patient presented with symptoms (cough and dyspnea)
data.ct_narrative: Thorax HRCT showed bilaterally multiple, uniform, thin-walled cysts ranging between 0.5 and 2.5 cm in diameter, diffusely distributing from apex to basis of the lung. Upon review, micronodules smaller than 1 mm were identified.
data.ct_size: Cysts: 0.5-2.5 cm in diameter; micronodules: <1 mm
data.diagnostic_approach: Bronchoscopy was performed but was nondiagnostic. Patient underwent diagnostic right lower lobe and middle lobe wedge resections.
data.outcomes: No changes in thorax CT findings through three years follow up
data.title: An Unusual Case of Diffuse Pulmonary Meningotheliomatosis Accompanying with Cystic Lung Disease
data.authors: Nimet Aksel, Nur Yücel, Seher Susam, Fatma Demirci Üçsular, Ozan Usluer, Ahmet Emin Erbaycu
data.study_type_narrative: A rare case of diffuse pulmonary meningotheliomatosis accompanied with cystic lung disease, demonstrating a unique presentation.

results.filename: Alkurashi et al. - 2020 - Diffuse Pulmonary Meningotheliomatosis A Rare Lung Disease Presenting with Diffuse Ground-Glass Opa.pdf

data.filename: Alkurashi et al. - 2020 - Diffuse Pulmonary Meningotheliomatosis A Rare Lung Disease Presenting with Diffuse Ground-Glass Opa.pdf
data.patient_demographics_narrative: 55-year-old woman, lifelong nonsmoker, worked as a saleswoman. Past medical history of hypertension, hypercholesterolemia, hypothyroidism, gastroesophageal reflux disease, and impaired fasting blood glucose.
data.associated_conditions_narrative: History of hypertension, hypercholesterolemia, hypothyroidism, gastroesophageal reflux disease, and impaired fasting blood glucose
data.symptom_narrative: Non-exertional chest pressure and dry cough of 4-month duration. Physical examination was unremarkable.
data.discovery_reason: Symptomatic - presented with chest pressure and dry cough
data.pulmonary_function_testing_spirometry_na: Pulmonary function tests did not reveal any abnormalities
data.ct_narrative: High-resolution chest computed tomography showed innumerable diffuse small ground-glass nodules, some of which demonstrated central cavitation.
data.pathological_features_narrative: Multiple well-circumscribed interstitial meningothelial-like nodules in perivenular distribution with occasional whorling of cells
data.histology_narrative: Histologic sections showing multiple well-circumscribed interstitial meningothelial-like nodules with predominant perivenular distribution. The nodules are composed of oval-to-spindle cells with indistinct cellular borders and uniform oval nuclei. Whorling of the tumor cells noted.
data.diagnostic_approach: Right video-assisted thoracoscopic surgery (VATS) with multiple lung biopsies
data.management_narrative: Observation - no specific treatment mentioned beyond diagnosis and monitoring
data.outcomes: Patient continued to complain of non-exertional chest pressure without pulmonary complaints. Repeat chest CT showed stable findings 1 year after diagnosis.
data.title: Diffuse Pulmonary Meningotheliomatosis: A Rare Lung Disease Presenting with Diffuse Ground-Glass Opacities and Cavitation
data.authors: Adham K. Alkurashi, Yahya Almodallal, Hasan Ahmad Hasan Albitar, John C. Cheville, Vivek N. Iyer
data.study_type_narrative: A rare case of Diffuse pulmonary meningotheliomatosis in a 55-year-old woman
